bibl.title: Peter Nelson et al v. Lewis V Wycoff. Civil
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

person.persName: Nelson Peter, Smith W, Elsner H, Whaley C, Mattson G, Lundblad Charles, Coffrey Dennis & Annir Jacob

div1.p: In the Dist Court of the 3d Jud Dist of Washington Territory held at Seattle in and for the counties of King Kistap and Snohomish
In the matter of the appliccation of Peter Nelson W Smith H Elsner C Whaley G Matson Charles Lundblad Dennis Coffy & Jacob Annir for a writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Hon JR Lewis Judge &c and now come the aforesaid applicants on 5th May of to the suffising and contruction the statue of the said Lewis V Wycoff Dpty Marshal &c to the said Sg.
1st that said return does not show upon what charge or for what offense said applisants are held, or before what court they are held to answer

2 And said applicants aver the truth and first to be as follows by: that on or about the 8th day of April AD 1875 they shiped on board the Bark Bern
of the osean Se Seg Master for a voyage from San Fransisco to Seattle Puget Sound, And that afterwards on or about the 11th day of the same month the said master proseeded to sen with said Bark and with these applisants on board without them signing any shipping contracts or agreement in writing or in print whatever that on or about the 23d day of April aforesaid, the said Bark arrived at the Port of Seattle King County Washington Territory at whish time & place said applisants are entitled to then dischge for said vessel, and then and there demanded to be so disshaged and paid off and that in consequense of sush demand to be disshaged and paid off, and for no other cause, the said Master S.E. Seg prosured the arrest and imprisonment of these applicants of after the arrest of said
vessel at said port of Seattle as aforesaid for alleged disobedience of orders and lawful commons of said Master and Officers of said Bark.
Also lisense said return is in the and insuffisient
